source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Centrolepidaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Centrolepidaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence turned to one side, 2–3 mm long, with the most basal primary bract much longer than others
Inflorescence erect, not turned to one side, 3–4 mm long, with the 2 most basal primary bracts much longer than others
